title: Minkowski inequality
summary: In mathematical analysis, the Minkowski inequality establishes that the Lp spaces are normed vector spaces. Let S {\displaystyle S} be a measure space, let 1 ≤ p < ∞ {\displaystyle 1\leq p<\infty } and let f {\displaystyle f} and g {\displaystyle g} be elements of L p ( S ) . {\displaystyle L^{p}(S).} Then f + g {\displaystyle f+g} is in L p ( S ) , {\displaystyle L^{p}(S),} and we have the triangle inequality
